intro: Chamaecladon rubens, commonly known as the redstem chamaecladon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chamaecladon rubens thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for arid environments.
